main.docTitle: Occupational Retirement Schemes (Authentication and Certification of Documents) Rules

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), each of the documents specified in Schedule 1 shall be authenticated, prior to its submission to the Registrar, by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notary lawfully exercising his functions in the place where the document was made; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person authorized under the laws of that place to administer an oath or take a statutory declaration.

subsection.leadIn: Each of the documents specified in Part 2 of Schedule 1 shall be authenticated in accordance with subsection (1) only if it was made by—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the holder of an identity card within the meaning of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate which does not have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: Where the Registrar so permits in any particular case and subject to such conditions as he thinks fit, a certified copy of a document specified in Schedule 1 may be submitted to him in lieu of that document as authenticated in accordance with subsection (1) and, in any such case, that copy so submitted shall be deemed to be that document as so authenticated and whether or not that document has been so authenticated.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), a power of attorney executed for the purpose of section 67(1B) of the Ordinance shall be authenticated by— (L.N. 361 of 1998)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notary lawfully exercising his functions in the place where the power of attorney was executed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person authorized under the laws of that place to administer an oath or take a statutory declaration.

subsection.leadIn: A power of attorney executed for the purpose of section 67(1B) of the Ordinance shall be authenticated in accordance with subsection (4) only if it was executed by— (L.N. 361 of 1998)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: ordinarily resident in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the holder of an identity card within the meaning of the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate which does not have a place of business in Hong Kong.

subsection.def: In this section, a certified copy (經證明的副本) means a copy which has been certified, prior to its submission to the Registrar, in the manner specified in section 3(1) and (2) as if it were a copy to which section 3(1) and (2) applies.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), each of the documents specified in Schedule 2, where it is a copy of or an extract from an original document, shall be certified, prior to its submission to the Registrar, as a true copy of or extract from the original document by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the administrator or designated person of the occupational retirement scheme to which the document relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notary lawfully exercising his functions in the place where the certification is made.

subsection.content: Certification under subsection (1)(a) shall be made either on oath or by a statutory declaration or by affidavit before a person authorized by the laws of the place where the certification is made to administer an oath or take a statutory declaration or affidavit.

subsection.leadIn: Where the Registrar so permits and subject to such conditions as he thinks fit, a copy of or an extract from an original document which has not been certified in accordance with subsection (1) may be submitted to him in lieu of a copy or an extract as certified in accordance with subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: certification in accordance with subsection (1) cannot be made on the ground that the original document—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has been lost or destroyed; or

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the copy or extract is accompanied by a statutory declaration in support of the relevant ground referred to in paragraph (a).
